bug.short_desc: Using quote shortcut (ctrl + shift + .) in reply to email often crashes Eudora OSE

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.10) Gecko/20100914 Firefox/3.6.10 GTB7.1 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0E) Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.1.9) Gecko/20100722 Eudora/3.0.4
When I reply to an email I often copy and paste bits into my reply from the original message or other messages. I then quote these using the ctrl + shift + . shortcut to distinguish my text from other peoples texts.
Eudora OSE often crashes on applying the shortcut.
Reproducible: Sometimes
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Reply to message (it seems to occur more often for text only messages). 2. Select couple of lines from reply and copy it to top of page. 3. Select pasted lines and press ctrl + shift + . 4. Sometimes Eudora crashes straight away sometimes it takes a couple of re-quoting the same quoted text. Actual Results: Eudora OSE crashed with crash report:
Add-ons: en-GB@dictionaries.addons.mozilla.org:1.19.1,inspector@mozilla.org:2.0.9,{D1D37B8A-4F3C-11DB-8373-B622A1EF5492}:1.0,nl-NL@dictionaries.addons.mozilla.org:3.0.1,{972ce4c6-7e08-4474-a285-3208198ce6fd}:3.0.4 BuildID: 20100722200145 CrashTime: 1302172474 InstallTime: 1284968723 ProductName: Eudora OSE SecondsSinceLastCrash: 427 StartupTime: 1302172050 Theme: classic/1.0 Throttleable: 1 URL: Vendor: Version: 3.0.4
This report also contains technical information about the state of the application when it crashed.
Expected Results: Quoted text not a crash report
Don't know whether it will matter, but I've setup my replies in Account Settings > Composition & Addressing to: checked "compose messages in HTML format" checked "automatically quote the original message when replying" then "start my reply above the quote." place signature "below the quote (recommended)" checked "include signature for replies" unchecked "include signature for forwards"
Qualcomm's Eudora used to have the opposite short cut ctrl + shift + , to unquote a quoted text, but this doesn't seem to work at all any more.
Any additional questions please let me know!
